Package prkmodel.utils

Interface Builder<T>

Type Parameters:
T - the type of object that this builder creates
All Known Implementing Classes:
DefaultNervousSystem.DefaultNervousSystemBuilder, RepastNervousSystem.RepastNervousSystemBuilder
public interface Builder<T>
Interface representing a builder pattern for creating instances of type T. It provides methods to build an instance and reset the builder to its initial state.

This interface follows the builder pattern, as described by Joshua Bloch in "Effective Java, 2nd Edition, Item 2: Builder Pattern". It is a flexible way to create complex objects step-by-step.

Additionally, this pattern is a well-known design pattern from the "Gang of Four" (GoF) design patterns, which promotes the construction of complex objects step by step.

Since:
2024-07-03
Version:
1.0
Author:
Samuele95
See Also:
  • Exploring Joshua Bloch's Builder Design Pattern in Java
  • Builder Pattern (Gang of Four)

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    T
    build()
    Builds and returns an instance of type T.
    default Builder<T>
    buildAndReset()
    Builds an instance of type T and then resets the builder to its initial state.
    Builder<T>
    reset()
    Resets the builder to its initial state.

  • Method Details

    • build

      T build()
      Builds and returns an instance of type T.
      Returns:
      the built instance of type T.

    • reset

      Builder<T> reset()
      Resets the builder to its initial state.
      Returns:
      the Builder instance after reset.

    • buildAndReset

      default Builder<T> buildAndReset()
      Builds an instance of type T and then resets the builder to its initial state.
      Returns:
      the Builder instance after build and reset.
